ticket.title: [PATCH] number_to_currency should take configured format for default negative format
ticket.original-body:
By resolved ticket #5894 number_to_currency compose default `:negative_format` only from options sent to method or takes it from `DEFAULT_CURRENCY_VALUES`.
I think, it should also consider format specified in `I18n.translate(:'number.currency.format')`
For example, gem `Russian` specify `ru.number.currency.format` as `%n %u` so that `number_to_currency(10)=='10,00 rur'`. But for negative values `DEFAULT_CURRENCY_VALUES[:negative_values_format]` is used, so that `number_to_currency(-10)=='-rur.10,00'` which is wrong. If negative format were taken as `'-' + currency[:format]` then formatted value will be `'-10,00 rur.'` which is right.
Patch below.
